website_summaries.verdict: Light enough to take on the road, this portable fire pit is ready for your next camping or tailgating adventure.
pros: Easily stowed in your vehicle for camping, parties, tailgating or other adventures
Included decorative lava rocks are long lasting and complete the look for maximum visual appeal

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, very lifelike, and put out decent heat
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after reading the reviews, and most were spot on. Really nothing to assemble, just unpack and pour the lava rocks in. I had some ceramic logs that we also put on, as it was mentioned in another review that it gave the flames a more lifelike feel. It put out decent heat, we actually had to turn it down and back away a few times. Was a perfect substitute for camping in an area where campfire and charcoal grills were prohibited due to fire danger. Very happy with the fire pit and would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Couthren

customer_reviews.title: Just what he wanted
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband. He wanted a small, portable, propane powered fire pit. This is exactly what he got. It took minutes to set up and worked like a dream. Note that the cover is sold separately. We would have like the propane hose to be longer for aesthetics , it is plenty long to keep the tank out of the conversation area, just not long enough to conceal the tank behind shrubs. Overall it was just what he wanted. We have only had it a short time so I can't speak to durability.
customer_reviews.author: GPetty

customer_reviews.title: Damaged item after two orders (to include the replacement) when received.
customer_reviews.text: I've had to reorder the firepit twice; the 1st order arrived with a big scratch and a dent on the upper rim and I returned it back for a replacement. The replacement arrived and once again it too had a big scratch on the upper rim plus it had a bigger dent than the 1st one. I've returned both. Perhaps the 3rd time is a charm when I reorder & have received. Patience is a virtue...so I'll wait and see.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Instant Fire, just don't plan on smores!
customer_reviews.text: Even though the picture is not real flames, the ones that come off this are great! Have been enjoying this now for over a month, and we wanted to see how it held up before we posted a review. We are through 2 tanks of propane, and it's WONDERFUL! If you have 2-6 people around it, everyone can stay comfortable and warm if it's cool. Just don't suggest roasting anything over it, as the briquetes you get with them are not easy to clean. It does come with replacements, but just a few and to buy new ones is expensive, so I just say use for a decorative and warm fire.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne C

customer_reviews.title: Lovely To Look At.
customer_reviews.text: I really like it, I feel safer using this that wood, in the summer most evening the winds can be pretty gusty and I am afraid of ashes blowing and causing a fire in the dry field and trees that surround my property plus I use it on my wooden deck.
customer_reviews.author: Larry J. E.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice. You have to prime the gas through sometimes ...
customer_reviews.text: Turned my wood burning table into a propane one. Very nice. You have to prime the gas through sometimes but once it kicks in, it has a nice high flame. Adjustment is nice. Brings the flame down nice and low. Worth the price for not dealing with messy cleanup after wood burning.
customer_reviews.author: SIM

customer_reviews.title: Way beyond our expectations!!!
customer_reviews.text: Way beyond our expectations!!! We are so please with this purchase! We set this up underneath our outdoor canopy and it kept us all very warm and cozy. The flame gets pretty high and it gives off tons of heat. We enjoy being able to turn it up and down for roasting marshmallows or just for the atmosphere. We haven't gone through much gas as many have said on other reviews. The size is perfect, there was no odor or smell. The only thing was having to light it yourself which isn't really wasn't that big a deal if you have a long lighter handy. All in all we give it five stars!!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher E. Marth

customer_reviews.title: Campfires are BACK!
customer_reviews.text: Love the propane campfire set! In our area there are frequent campfire bans in the summer due to risk of forest fire so we thought our campfires were a thing of the past until we found the Heininger 5995. JUST the right size for a nice fire and never banned at National or State Forrest lands. Only upgrade we would suggest is a carrying bag for the fire ring and rocks so it is easier to pack. A slightly longer hose would be nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: LakeLady

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Everyone needs this for camping. Don't have to worry about carrying wood, smoke, or having to make sure it is out. Sit it where you want it, hook up the tank and turn on, its that easy. Puts off a lot of heat plus it's adjustable for warmer or colder nights. When your ready to go to bed or leave, just turn off the gas and your good. Easy to store and move around. A must have for RV'ers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great heat!
customer_reviews.text: These gas logs work great! They are easy to put together, you basically just place the lava rocks on fire pit and you're done. Hooking up the tank was super easy. You will need a lighter to ignite the flame since there is no built-in igniter. To me that is no big deal because they always wear out pretty soon anyway. It puts out a good amount of heat and we were quite surprised as we used it for Thanksgiving, and the extended family sat around it on our deck. We have a wood fire pit but this is so much more convenient and easy, not to mention the lack of the smell of smoke in hair and clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: it looks awesome. The first one still works but the regulator ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have purchased. The first one lasted about 3 years outside and unprotected. It looks small out of the box but when you add a hacienda block circle around it, it looks awesome. The first one still works but the regulator started to fail and not provide enough gas. 10’ hose set ups are not cheap so it was more cost effective for me to just get a new one. The new one has a rubber grip on the dial which I like better than the old style dial. (old one was the stove dial design)
customer_reviews.author: Geoff in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs. I use it on my patio. It is winter but I like to watch the sunsets so I light this puppy up and sit behind it to keep me warm enough in 30-40 degree temperature. Tip: when lighting on use a long neck lighter and stick it well close enough to the burner ring, turn on the gas in LOW position ... otherwise you might get a free eyebrow job. I had it together and running under 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Denis

customer_reviews.title: Great little fire pit!!
customer_reviews.text: Great fire pit! My son bought one and I liked it soo much I got one for myself. Works and looks fantastic. I love how portable it is. The fire looks great and there’s no mess. I live in the country and do enjoy a nice natural wood fire also, but this is nice for that quick effortless fire to enjoy after work when you only have a little bit of chill time. Quality is great. It’s especially nice that I can virtually take it anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: The code guy

customer_reviews.title: Easy did I mention easy
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can go on the back deck with a lighter turn the knob on, click the lighter and FIRE !! Yes I'm getting lazy in my older age. I’ve had this 2-1/2 yrs now and just noticed that the burner is disintegrating. I’ve never had a cover on it. So this to be expected. This fire pit has been awesome as a portable unit. Never had any issues that some people have complained about. So I contacted manufacturer and the were able to send me a replacement burner and gas valve and more rocks. David was very helpful and responded quickly. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Radiantking

customer_reviews.title: Yep, instant fire and decent heat - travels well!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for road trips in camper when we don't have space to pack firewood. Great choice! Used it everywhere (even when burn bans are on) and in minutes, had a nice warm fireside to sit by. The hose is long enough to allow the tank to be further away from your sitting/viewing area. The heat radiates probably only a foot or two away, but with lawn/camp chairs next to it, our feet and bodies were comfortable. I would recommend buying the lid for this, it makes hauling this around and keeping the rocks intact easy and clean. We would purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Greenwell

customer_reviews.title: well made
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use (yes you have to manually light it). Flames on mine do not go anywhere near as high as in picture. Realistically about 1/2 to 1/3 that high. I actually see very little difference between High and Low settings. I use low to make the gas last longer. I have not actually ran it enough to give an idea of how long a tank will last. Item is well built and I like the large lava rocks it comes with. Includes 3 sizes of lava rock. I purchased mainly for camping but find I use it at home rather building a wood fire.
customer_reviews.author: Pictureman

customer_reviews.title: Good pit for DIY pit tables or camping.
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine for a built in table application. It came damaged, box crushed and legs bent, lip chipped. I touched up the chips with grill paint and cut the legs off. The circle base was set in concrete and I dropped the grill in. Works great. Heat is good. The dial goes past the low setting but it hisses a lot then. It smells a little like propane when in use.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: WAY better than wood burning fire pit!
customer_reviews.text: So much cleaner and easier. Fire wood costs so much these days it pays for itself after one season of camping. Plus I don't have to worry about bugs or snakes, and no more smelling like smoke for 3 days! This thing is so easy to use, best purchase we made for our camping experience.
customer_reviews.author: Boondocking Adventures dot com

customer_reviews.title: Made in China! Lava rocks need rinsing b4 use
customer_reviews.text: Made in China! Hard to get lid and straps in place. Lava rocks very dusty, you're going to want to rinse that off before burning, after they dry out. Ordered Heininger, lid says Outland? Thought this was supposed to be made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I’d buy it again!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome for camping where there are fire restrictions and for no-burn air quality days. It’s nice to be able to shut it off and it’s OFF. No lingering coals to worry about. It doesn’t even make the ground warm underneath. Very safe in the dry mountains. (Still wise to clear space around it.) Plus: no campfire smoke Minus: no campfire smoke
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Went bad after 4 uses
customer_reviews.text: This product no longer works well after 4 uses. No mater what I do, the flame no longer turns up. It is on super low all the time. Changed tanks several times and still doesn’t respond. Cleaned it out as well. Nothing is blocking the gas burner. A waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: techstudent

customer_reviews.title: It worked great and didn't put of too much heat
customer_reviews.text: LOVEDDDDDDDDDDD this fire place so much. It worked great and didn't put of too much heat. It also doesn't burn as much gas as I thought it would. I was great for relaxing nights and parties. It makes a small hissing noise but not enough to be alarming or annoying while entertaining. I did end up misplacing this in a move from California, but I will be purchasing another.
customer_reviews.author: Teslah Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, works well,
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and function of the unit, specially for camping. When done with the fire, I turn it off and go to bed, no more waiting an hour for fire to die out. Puts out pretty decent heat. I'm not terribly impressed with the rocks, there was a lot of dust and debris left in the bag and some blacken where other don't, but seems to work well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Curt S. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: I added a SHUTOFF TIMER to this firepit. Super helpfull!
customer_reviews.text: Fireplace works great, but if it's left on, it can run all night and empty a propane tank. I installed a shutoff timer and the fireplace shuts off after 60 minutes! See my review here:  I highly recommend the shutoff timer! It will save you a lot of propane!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great choice to brighten an evening.
customer_reviews.text: As full-time RVers, we love this portable fire pit. We enjoy the fire without the mess and extra work of wood. Additionally, there is no smoke smell to deal with which is a plus for us due to my husbands lung issues. Last, when campfires are prohibited due to fire danger, 90% of the time we can still use our fire pit, which brings other campers to come join us for an evening of conversation.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: No Cover
customer_reviews.text: The description I read said a cover was included, that's one of the reason I bought this one... there was NO cover. I'm kinda pissed about it, we needed it for this weekend. I would DEFINITELY have chosen another fire pit that actually included the cover... lair liar pants on fire.
customer_reviews.author: General_Limit

customer_reviews.title: A great outdoor fire for small spaces and you don’t smell like campfire!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great! It provides a little bit of heat on very cool evenings (it is pretty small) and is a real bonus when you are in dry parts of the country with fire restrictions that still allow propane-burning fuel sources. We use it all the time and have only had to replace the propane tank once, so it seems pretty efficient. Definitely recommended!
customer_reviews.author: J. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected, fun and Looks Great!
customer_reviews.text: Better than I expected! This was super easy to set up and use and it also looks great as well! I was skeptical having a propane fire pit instead of the usual wood burning ones at camp grounds, but this feels the same! Only thing is some members of the family liked poking around at the wood and messing with the fire. Oh well they will get over it!
customer_reviews.author: Tom The Husband

customer_reviews.title: Nice, portable fire pit!
customer_reviews.text: This fire pit is great. Perfect size for being portable, yet big enough to feel like an actual fire pit (as opposed to a tiny barbecue-like pit). It is a bit "open" from the sides, so I purchased a regular, larger fire pit enclosure to place this one inside that has solid walls so my dogs won't go up in flames. I also added a gas log set on top and only used a portion of the supplied lava rock. It looks much more real and inviting this way, at least for my taste. So far so good on propane consumption...I've used it a few times, probably totaling about 6-8 hours, and my propane tank is still going strong/seems full.
customer_reviews.author: Devin H.

customer_reviews.title: Best portable fire pit ever for 100 bucks.
customer_reviews.text: This fire pit is beyond amazing for the price. We replaced our old on from Lowe's with this beauty. The old one had barely visible flames where you have to really put marshmallows practically on the lava rocks. It was pretty scary trying to light the thing because it explodes even if the tank is barely opened. The Heininger 5995 is much bigger than I expected, it's lightweight easy to assemble. The only assembly needed was to add the rocks. It gives off alot of heat and perfect for camping or hanging out in the backyard. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Zachary C. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Puts out an impressive amount of heat.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice fire pit. Puts out quite a bit of heat for such a small unit. I'm going to make an enclosure for it so it will look better on our patio. It does put off a very nice Flame if you follow the directions. As with most stuff I buy on Amazon I go by reviews and the reviews on this were great and it is great.
customer_reviews.author: SammyT

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!
customer_reviews.text: This firepit was a hit on our last camping trip, as there was a burn-ban in effect. This thing really has a great flame and throws good heat. Everyone was impressed! It's lightweight/easy to move and we used it for around 8 hours (about 4 each night) and I still had propane left over in my tank. Several in our party will be purchasing one!
customer_reviews.author: Paula J. Burmeister

customer_reviews.title: Diminished flame Output
customer_reviews.text: I've had this fire pit for about 3 years and I love it. It's perfect for sitting outside during the winter with a cigar. However I find that the flame output is very diminished now. After emptying out the stones and cleaning the burner I still am not getting full flame like I used to. I wonder if anyone else has had this problem and if there is a recommended maintenance or solution to restoring the flame output. I'd appreciate any advice
customer_reviews.author: Ronald J. Salerno

customer_reviews.title: Toasty!
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and looks great. Best of all no smoke. Now my wife and I can spend a few hours out on the patio at night enjoying the warmth and not have to shower after because our clothes smell like smoke. This unit produces good heat. Trick is to let it get good and hot for about 5 min on high then adjust the intensity as desired, also once it gets hot the flames change from the blue propane (When it's cold) to normal rich red. I used all the provided pumice stones including the extra ones with no change in the heat quality.
customer_reviews.author: P. Mills

customer_reviews.title: Camping, cold mornings...instant warmth with little effort
customer_reviews.text: We love our propane fire pit! It is really easy to set up, very portable and 1standard propane tank last several days. We keep ours on low most of the time and the heat output is great. Our whole family loves it. This also works great for camping, especially those cold mornings when you dont want to wait for a fire. This is instant warm with little effort! We have already recommended this to several friends.
customer_reviews.author: dawn novak

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but.....
customer_reviews.text: The firepit works well. But the heat doesn't really disperse horizontally, so you need some other sort of gas log which are really expensive. So outside on a still cold night you're still freezing. Also, you probably don't want to use this without a cover...But the cover is like $40 separately which is ridiculous. I bought a metal trash can lid and painted it black....Hey... it works.
customer_reviews.author: J.R.

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: We are all sitting around this fire pit right now and it is fantastic. I have had none of the issues others have mentioned about flame or odor of the rocks. It is well made and a very good deal. You can buy the same thing from a big box hardware store for about the same price but I prefer Amazon just for the speed it arrived. Easy to set up, and use right out of the box. I see us using this probably on a daily basis and taking it places because it is very portable and light.
customer_reviews.author: koldflow

customer_reviews.title: This is great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last year on Amazon for $106. Love it!!! Put it on my deck on a cool November night here in Ohio while entertaining. Put a piece of plywood underneath. It was great!!! Throws off some heat! Ok, if its 40 degrees out or windy, this won't get it. But if it's a nice fall or spring night and about 55 or more, this will be great to take the chill off. I'm a very picky buyer, and this was very portable, and well constructed. I had no problems setting it up or operating it. No smoke either!!! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Alfons

customer_reviews.title: Perfect purchase
customer_reviews.text: A friend got one of these from a local store, paid a lot more then when we ordered ours. Use it when we go cow camping in the fall to bring the cows home. Feel a bit safer as no sparks fly and being in the mountains... it's nice cause you can just turn the tank off. Easy to pack and go... it's. Ice too as there is no smoke and you can shower and then sit by the fire and enjoy the night... we bring it right under the awning and can still leave the door open and get close... very happy with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Cheri Langus

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: So far been burning about 1.5 lbs of gas per hour on low. Very satisfied with the burn rate. Gets very warm after about 10 or 15 minutes even on low. I don't see a need to run it on high. You can be a gas miser if you want and turn it down further with the valve on the tank side, smaller flames will still produce enough heat and fire to enjoy your evening.
customer_reviews.author: Mf

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This little fire pit is so nice, throws off a lot of heat on low as well as higher flames. You can roast hot dogs, make marshmallows for smores, and all safe without worries about fire dangers. We've had burn bans almost this whole summer due to drought conditions, so campfires are not an option. These little guys will be the only way you're going to have campfires, everyone who camps needs to get one. You won't regret it. Plus you don't have to duck the smoke while sitting around the campfire!
customer_reviews.author: J. Perrigoue

customer_reviews.title: Love, love this product
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are so happy we bought this product. We have a large new covered deck and this worked perfect for us. We have it sitting on a heavy metal coffee table with our patio chairs around it. We have used it almost every day sine we purchased it and even enjoyed it a few weeks ago when we had a family gathering here. Love the fact there is no smoke blowing in your face as that is what happened when we had a pit you had to use real wood. Very, very pleased with this fire pit.
customer_reviews.author: BYP

customer_reviews.title: Really enjoy this fire pit.
customer_reviews.text: I love it, what else can I say. No more musical chairs trying to get out of the smoke. No more waiting on the fire to die down before bed. Turn the knob, light, and enjoy. I have not had any of the issues others have mentioned. No loud hissing and the flames are plenty high. Just turn the gas bottle on slow. I was able to get around 8 hours out of my propane bottle.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Best LP Firepit
customer_reviews.text: So glad I waited until I found this one. Wanted an LP fire pit for some time. Had seen the ones camping world sells in action and was not impressed. This is attractive and the flames get high. The closest thing to a wood fire I've seen. It is a little dangerous to light. I can have my sparker going when I turn the gas on and I still get a big poof of flames. Get a long sparker/lighter and stand back. We travel with this so I ordered the metal cover. Also worth every penny. Fits perfectly and acts as a handle to carry it.
customer_reviews.author: Edward J Marchiselli

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Overwhelming how beatiful this is. Made our nights so pleasant n relaxing. Very well made. Easy to set up. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Km

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Some of the reviews knock both the size of the flame and the quick use of propane. We have not experienced this at all. If the flame were any hotter you wouldn't have been able to get within 10 feet and our 20 pound cylinder is still half-full after about 4 hours or use. Although we love a wood fire this is a great substitute without the mess and you don't smell like a campfire. We are camping several places this summer that are prohibiting wood fires due to the drought so this will be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Morris Branson

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for camping during fire bans, as you can still burn propane. There is a nice flame; maybe not as hot as a wood burning fire, but still nice. No smoke in your eyes, no pouring water on hot ashes. Easy to transport. Our 15 gallon tank lasted around 10 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Debbi S

customer_reviews.title: Best $100 that I have spent ... EVER
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I have ever made. We recently attended a camping event and it was cold and rainy. If it wasn't for this baby we would have frozen (fire ban in effect). I had people approach us from nearby campsites asking where we got this and what is it. The amount of heat that you get is remarkable (make sure to turn the dial slowly and it will work like magic). A regular full tank of propane lasts about 14-16 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Viktor Plokhov

customer_reviews.title: Must have for RV’s
customer_reviews.text: I really like this most campgrounds won’t let you have an open fire this is a good substitute
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I received this yesterday. Shipping was fast! Very impressed. Even packaged very well. It comes already assembled, just throw the lava rocks in (even labeled the bags to tell you the order to put the rocks in) and fire it up! Ran it for about 20 minutes last night to test it out. Burns nice gives off a lot of heat. Def worth the money.This will get a lot of use in my backyard this summer! My only gripe would be that it doesnt have a self ignitor, but I didnt check for that when I ordered so cant blame the product.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: We love this firepit
customer_reviews.text: We love this firepit. We placed it in the bottom of an older wood-burning fire pit to get it up off the ground and to create more space around it as we have dogs on the deck all the time who don't understand the concept of fire and long tails that can burn...in this configuration it is much safer and easier to use. It has worked excellently so far and if you're conservative with the flame will last through a dozen evenings on the deck (temps in mid-50s). We LOVE the long gas line. It enables us to put the propane tank under the deck.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Burr

customer_reviews.title: I full time in my RV and yet I like a fire I don't always like smelling like fire
customer_reviews.text: I full time in my RV and yet I like a fire I don't always like smelling like fire... so this is perfect... also being able to use it when there are wood fire restrictions or you don't have wood to burn... it has really been a nice addition to boondocking live fulltiming in the motorhome...
customer_reviews.author: Waianaegal

customer_reviews.title: Great, Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this fire pit. It's not as large as past ones I've had, but I like it the size better. In the past I've had the log burning type and it was always expensive to buy wood and the clean up was always such a pain. I often used the chemical treated logs and you can't use them to do hot dogs and marshmallows. It is so nice being able to do this without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: DAB

customer_reviews.title: worked great Our first trip out camp ground did not allow ...
customer_reviews.text: bought this and Flame King (100304-48) 48" RV Low Pressure Quick Connect Pigtail was able to connect to my fifth wheel quick connect. worked great Our first trip out camp ground did not allow fires but did allow propane fire pits. we roast marsh mellows and hot dog worked great. saw two other camp sites using same one all liked the convenience and camp atmosphere it gave without the danger of wood fire in our drought-stricken​ forest.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie G. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Fit our needs
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful little firebowl. Definitely warms the cold nights! We use it for about an hour a nite when we are outside visiting & having our adult beverage & cigarettes before going to sleep. The only drawback to this firebowl seems to be that it uses quite a bit of propane & we have it on low. It worked out to $1.50 a nite for one hour. But it is a nice warmth & I feel it's well worth it. Sure helps having a warm fire as our nites were in the high 20's & low 30's!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lebeck

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, at first blush
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box (not a lot of usage yet) this is ideal for home and camping. Portable, sturdy, easily lit, bright/powerful flame...it has it all. Placed it on a deck surface and the area beneath the pan is cool after 1 hour of usage. We intend to use w our Airstream camping, as well as at home. O
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: No lid
customer_reviews.text: This does not come with a lid. You have to wait until it cools to transport. I wouldn’t leave it on your porch in the rain. I’ve had a similar model for 4 years. Came with a locking lid. I’d return it but it’s too much of a hassle. I see you can buy a lid for 44 bucks. I don’t think it locks though so you can carry it
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: Incredulous!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and neighbors love it! You can't beat it for a portable pit. I tried getting a model from the local home improvement stores, but they are not meant to be moved. If you really wanted to, you could build an enclosure for this pit in one area, and still move this when necessary. We usually bring it out when the air is chilled after a BBQ. Kids enjoy roasting marshmallows around it as well. I never run it on high... The flames are huge even on the lowest setting. Lots of warmth without the smoke!
customer_reviews.author: 8AA2YM

customer_reviews.title: It's Great.
customer_reviews.text: Throws out a lot of heat even set at the lowest setting and it's made from good quality heavier gauge steel- very well made. Not a produc you'll be tossing out after just a couple of seasons of use due to rust and broken welds. Unfortunately, this thing goes through propane like crazy. Plan on always having a couple of full cylinders on hand if you're going to use it regularly. Almost perfect but deducting one star because it doesn't come with a cover of any kind.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: I like this product
customer_reviews.text: I like this product! Set up was soooooooo easy! Was looking for something for on my patio that kicked off a good amount of heat with no smoke. This is FANTASTIC!!! We have had a really cool rainy spring and this fire pit has made it possible to enjoy the cool nights really comfortably!!! I'm a wood fire girl at heart but I have to say this is great no hassle starting your a fire. I have even used it in the rain under a canopy on a chilly night ad it has not let me down!!!! Would highly recommend this! It came with a soft cover that seems to be really good quality too!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and power for an outdoor balcony!
customer_reviews.text: We have a balcony that's about 5' x 15', this was perfect in a San Diego "winter", might have been about 50 degrees out at it's coldest. For some this will probably not be enough power, but it's perfect for our space. We roasted marshmallows and chestnuts on it, worked very well! If you're thinking this is a portable bonfire, it isn't, spend a bit more money and I'm sure you'll find it, but is probably the smallest "fire pit" I've ever seen and it's exactly what would fit on our balcony.
customer_reviews.author: isunktheship

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This an awesome fire bowl for so many reasons! Its small enough to be portable and large enough to provide the perfect amount of ambiance. There is no smoke and (after the initial newness burns off) there is little smell. We are often in a burn ban and its too hot for a fire but this provides just enough heat to not overwelm you. I didnt realize how much I hated the smoke, sparks and soot of a real fire until they were no longer there when using this! This is clean and convienent and there was no worries that a spark would hit a child or pet! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: James Womack

customer_reviews.title: Great for a camp fire when it is too dry for a natural fire.
customer_reviews.text: Great way to be able to enjoy a fire when we can not have a real camp fire. I put all the rocks in and the flame only rose about 1 foot above the pit. After taking some of the rocks out, the flame got taller.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Fetsch

customer_reviews.title: Very Fun Night Out in the Driveway
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this firepit. We are city people and do not go camping. This firepit is great for summer/fall evenings when the neighbors are over for drinks in the driveway. Works great for the kids to make smores, too. We use a standard grille tank (20 lbs. I believe). 1 full tank seems to last us about 3-4 evenings of use - maybe 2 hours on each evening. What we really like about this is the absence of smoke.
customer_reviews.author: lunchroom

customer_reviews.title: Best buy for camping and the patio warmth
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. Took it camping and roasted marshmallows on it too. When there is a fire ban on, this is perfect. Have it out on the patio as well during the summer months for a nice night time warmth. Super long hose... and doesn't go through gas at all. I ran it all summer on one small propane tank (about 4-5 hours a week for 3 months). I had it on low...and the flames are about 1/2 foot above the rocks. Tons of heat.
customer_reviews.author: Fulrcum

customer_reviews.title: Love this fire pit.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size for our RV campgrounds patio. And it is easy to attach to the gas tank we also use for the grill. It puts out a nice, attractive fire and warms you on a cool evening. We also like that only the top gets hot. Under the fire pit where we have it sitting is cool so the mat that covers our concrete patio never has a chance of overheating. And the price was very reasonable. Shipped to our campground in two days via Prime!
customer_reviews.author: Bluemoondog

customer_reviews.title: Nicest fire pit
customer_reviews.text: It’s the nicest fire pit we’ve owned. Easy to use. Easy to take camping. We use it at home and when camping.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Soper

customer_reviews.title: Portable and sturdy. Was black not bronze
customer_reviews.text: Portable and sturdy. Was black not bronze. Took it camping and was great for the mornings when it's still chilli in the desert. Much warmer than expected. We also use it in the backyard for colder nights. We love it. I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MJKreischer

customer_reviews.title: Great unit that gulps fuel.
customer_reviews.text: Item works as promised with easy set up and a nice campfire like flame. Would have given it 5 stars except for the fact that it burns fuel much faster than I expected. Seems to put out more heat than a wood fire of the same size. Tip: Open box outside as there is a lot of dust associated with the bags of lava rocks.
customer_reviews.author: dane714

customer_reviews.title: good price for what you get!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because sometimes we go camping at private campgrounds and you cannot have a wood burning fire there. This fits perfectly in the truck (it will get ash and dust around, because of the rocks in there). It was a lot bigger than we expected. It does NOT come with a cover, or anything to put it in, but that did not bother us. It is very warm, and works well :) Very happy with this product and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: erika

customer_reviews.title: Nice, realistic fire, great for outdoor gatherings.
customer_reviews.text: This pit produces the most realistic fire I have seen in a portable fire pit. Puts out a fair amount of heat, too. I use it for RV camping, and also on the deck at home, Build quality is pretty good, Everyone who sees it in operation asks where I got it, and a number of folks have bought them after seeing mine. Doesn't disappoint! At full power, it will burn around 8-10 hours on a standard 20lb grill tank. It;s great to have a nice fire without the smoke chasing folks around.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Nemeth

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great for a fire any where without the smoke smell. Wonderful for on your patio. I have wood burning fire place and use this more often! Turn off and no worries. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: sandi l

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this fire pit!!! I keep it stored It stored in My motorhome and when I want a fire it's instant, no smoke, no firewood. I love a good camp fire with wood, but this really is the best substitute, good size flames that can be adjusted down. Everyone asks me where I got it. Guess it's just that cool!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ronette M.

customer_reviews.title: We have tried everything we could possibly do to get ...
customer_reviews.text: We have tried everything we could possibly do to get this pit to work properly and have not had any luck....Update: Amazon has sent us a new one at no charge! I will post after we try the new one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! This fire pit works really well. If I want to have a fire for 30 minutes it's no problem. We have a small back yard and houses next to us are close. Now no more worries about smoke, flying embers, or the hassle of putting out a real wood wood fire. The main con you don't get the real wood smell. The pros outweigh that one con though. Gas consumption seems very good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This may be a the little bit smaller side...but we love it! We have a family of 5 and it was plenty big for us to sit around the campfire. It gives off a nice flame and we actually roasted hot dogs and s'mores with it. It will warm you up on a cool evening as well. The pit itself is nice looking too. Very pleased with it (and plus...you don't smell like a campfire).
customer_reviews.author: half pint

customer_reviews.title: No smoke hassles and warm enough.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Functions as expected putting off plenty of clean heat for up to 5 or 6 people sitting around the fire. It's a real advantage over wood if you don't want to smell like smoke and move away from the smoke constantly. Easy start and uses about the same amount of fuel as your gas grill on high. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Mabrey

customer_reviews.title: Great pit!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome!! We had a larger fire pit on the deck that needed replaced. We decided on this since it’s easily moved, we use it in the camper and for fire pit nights on the deck!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a Hot-dang!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this online for my husband for Christmas. We do the local rodeo circuit in the summer because he judges chuckwagon races. Every evening we sit around one of these for protest hour, keeping the evening chill off. It works like a hot-dang and, because it is propane, you can use it even if there's a fire ban. No chopping and hauling wood required. You can even roast wieners or marshmallows if you want. My sister in law saw it and had me order one for her hubby too!
customer_reviews.author: S A Warrington

customer_reviews.title: Small and Portable with a great fire output
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a backup to the real the real thing when camping. For those times when wood burning is not an option, the output is great and relaxing to watch. The tank can be hidden behind you due to the long hose.
customer_reviews.author: AmySol

customer_reviews.title: One of my all time best/favorite purchases
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this thing. Use it all the time Best part is the convenience of it. It can be late at night and the wife and I will use it for 20 mins for a quick talk before going to bed. Can't do that with real wood! Also, seems to be very gas efficient. I just now went through my first tank this winter (we usually keep it on low here in FL). With I had got one sooner!
customer_reviews.author: EJ255

customer_reviews.title: Just what it says
customer_reviews.text: My only critique is that mine was black, as opposed to the dark copper color...but it still looks nice and emits plenty of heat! I have had no issue lighting mine, as other people mentioned. I hope to relocate the valve and surround the pit with brick, to make an inexpensive backyard fire pit. I am thinking of buying a second one for my front porch.
customer_reviews.author: SCHT

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job approximating a real wood fire with none of the pain.
customer_reviews.text: Really works well... The flames are big and pleasant to sit near. Does a good job approximating a real wood fire with none of the pain. UPDATE: I purchased this in August of 2013 and its now November 2015. Since then I have left it outside 100% of the time in the rain and the snow completely uncovered. It still looks great and fires right up. I would give it 6 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: WBoweIII

customer_reviews.title: This rig is fantastic. Portable
customer_reviews.text: This rig is fantastic. Portable, easy to use, and puts out a pretty good amount of heat. We have it on a small porch with the windows cracked and even though there's 5 feet of snow on the ground and wild gusting winds, we sit comfortably enjoying the outdoors in warmth and comfort. After a few minutes, the room is up to 80 degrees and we turn it down to the lowest setting. Looking forward to having it by the pool this summer!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great flame and heat
customer_reviews.text: Very nice flame and great heat. Follow the instructions concerning the over pressure valve because it was an issue for us. It is a fuel hog however but it throws the heat.
customer_reviews.author: money2burn

customer_reviews.title: The perfect portable fire pit
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, good price, easy to move around and puts out a lot of heat. I would not hesitate to recommend this product to friends and family. If you think you could benefit from having a portable LP gas fire pit that you can use easily whenever you feel the urge this one should work pretty much perfectly. I love this thing and everyone else I know does too. Lighting it up is a bit scary at first but it's really no big deal unless your perhaps seriously afraid of fire. Use fireplace matches or a candle lighter and be a bit careful and you'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Sam in Houston

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Just right for sitting around. When you are done, just turn off. Put lid on and go inside
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Dover

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: A fire pit-like design that really throws out heat! It's well made and easy to light, adjust, and store afterwards. I believe it's the best alternative to a real campfire. I purchased a durable cover to keep out the elements when not in use and also to transport it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: PrescottJer

customer_reviews.title: Works great. High quality construction. Shipped fast.
customer_reviews.text: Already owned one but purchased another for taking in the travel trailer. Other one is used frequently on the back patio. Work perfectly and can be used camping during burn bans.
customer_reviews.author: A. Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: just great for the price
customer_reviews.text: it came on time. no assembly needed other then hooking up the gas tank and putting the stones in the pit. flames are great. you can control the height perfectly. we got it yesterday and enjoyed toasting marshmallows and drinking beer next to it. definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Nice clean flame
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and adjust the flame output. I've only used it one trip so far but worked as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Pockell

customer_reviews.title: it's great
customer_reviews.text: I love this firepit. It puts out a lot of heat and the flames are really pretty. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: srbAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Going to Sturgis!
customer_reviews.text: Just like everyone says, great Fire pit! Have a group going to Sturgis and they don't allow regular fires, but a Gas Fire Pit is ok. This unit is well built, and puts out more flame and heat than I thought it would. Only thing I wish is that it had some sort of spark igniter system like a gas grill, you have to light this with a flame.
customer_reviews.author: T. Dog

customer_reviews.title: Very nice item
customer_reviews.text: I have this on my patio and use it on cooler nights. It puts out more than enough heat and creates a nice atmosphere without the smoke from a wood fire.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Chester

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Don't be fooled- this will put out the flames! This is perfect for camping and is incredibly portable. This is small enough to tote around but very powerful. A great price for the product!
customer_reviews.author: Brandifaith

customer_reviews.title: Best camping purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for our back yard as well as our most recent rainy camping trip. We were able to set it up on a picnic table under an 8x8 awning and it kept us all quite warm without setting the awning on fire! Super convenient. Guessing it took about 1/2 a tank of prapane for 5 solid hours of being on (lowest setting).
customer_reviews.author: Technobabble

customer_reviews.title: Nice ambience but don't expect an abundance of heat
customer_reviews.text: Nice ambience but don't expect an abundance of heat. They also provide many more rocks than necessary so use these sparingly as they will damper the flames. Overall good product if you have a cool, calm night.
customer_reviews.author: JayZ13

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking flames, works great
customer_reviews.text: I was worried this wouldn't put out flames that seem like a "real" fire, but it does. Also good warmth, pretty serious btu's, but that is what I was looking for. People at tailgating love it, and like the fact that they won't smell like a camp fire for the rest of the day. Recommended for sure. I think several friends have purchased their own.
customer_reviews.author: Chaser

customer_reviews.title: very good product
customer_reviews.text: very good i used this on a camping trip because we were on a fire restriction and it was perfect the kids were able to make smores it kept us warm at night i would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: denise navarro

customer_reviews.title: This little propane fire pit is AWESOME! You can control the output and even on ...
customer_reviews.text: This little propane fire pit is AWESOME! You can control the output and even on high it doesn't use that much fuel. We've had a pretty dry summer and have had fire bans all over the state. Where any open flames were not banned, this was great to have camping in our new motorhome! It's hard to camp without a fire...
customer_reviews.author: G. Carroll

product_meta.title: Heininger 5995 58,000 BTU Portable Propane Outdoor Fire Pit
product_meta.description: Style:Fire PitThe Heininger portable fire pit is the perfect center piece for outdoor adventure. Bring the warmth with you on your next camping trip or tailgating party; or light it up in your backyard, patio, beach, or RV park. The fire pit uses a regular propane tank (not included) and burns clean and smokeless--giving off enough heat to warm the whole family at night. Package includes fire pit, propane tank hose, and decorative rocks.
feature_bullets: Great for camping, backyards, patio or tailgating
58,000 BTU fire pit burns clean and smokeless
CSA approved fire pit is safe to use during most campfire bans; always check with the current fire restrictions in your area
Black Color 19 inch diameter All weather fire pit
Light Weight and easy to carry; 10 ft hose and lava rocks included

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars870 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
